title: The Shocking Truths our Survey Reveals About Affluent Indian Households!
summary: The current state of household finances in India presents several interesting patterns that warrant a closer look. In this episode, we delve into critical questions based on recent data: 1. What factors contribute to net household financial savings reaching a 50-year low of 5%?
fullContent: The current state of household finances in India presents several interesting patterns that warrant a closer look. In this episode, we delve into critical questions based on recent data: 1. What factors contribute to net household financial savings reaching a 50-year low of 5%? 2. How does India's household debt, at 34% of income (excluding home loans), fit into the broader economic picture? 3. Despite a significant increase in demat accounts, why has the base of income taxpayers remained consistent? 4. What implications does the rise of AI hold for affluent individuals? To understand the complexities Affluent Indians face, we collaborated with Dun and Bradstreet on a comprehensive survey. Join us for an in-depth analysis of its findings. title: DOGE Denizen Marko Elez Leaked API Key for xAI
summary: Marko Elez, a 25-year-old employee at Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), has been granted access to sensitive databases at the U.S. Social Security Administration, the Treasury and Justice departments, and the Department of Homeland Security.
fullContent: Marko Elez, a 25-year-old employee at Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), has been granted access to sensitive databases at the U.S. Social Security Administration, the Treasury and Justice departments, and the Department of Homeland Security. So it should fill all Americans with a deep sense of confidence to learn that Mr. Elez over the weekend inadvertently published a private key that allowed anyone to interact directly with more than four dozen large language models (LLMs) developed by Musk’s artificial intelligence company xAI. Image: Shutterstock, @sdx15. On July 13, Mr. Elez committed a code script to GitHub called “agent.py” that included a private application programming interface (API) key for xAI. The inclusion of the private key was first flagged by GitGuardian, a company that specializes in detecting and remediating exposed secrets in public and proprietary environments. GitGuardian’s systems constantly scan GitHub and other code repositories for expose
